text:
Vanilla http 2.0.35 fails to compile.

Transcript (shortened):

$ uname -a
SunOS goedel.admin.phil.uu.nl 5.7 Generic_106541-18 sun4u sparc SUNW,Ultra-250
$ gcc --version
3.0.2
$ ./configure --enable-layout=phil.layout:Phil \
                --enable-mods-shared=most
[snip, snip]
$ make
[snip, snip, snip]
make[3]: Entering directory `/phil/src/httpd-2.0.35/modules/aaa'
Building shared: mod_access.la mod_auth.la mod_auth_anon.la mod_auth_dbm.la mod_auth_digest.la
make[4]: Entering directory `/phil/src/httpd-2.0.35/modules/aaa'
/bin/sh /phil/src/httpd-2.0.35/srclib/apr/libtool --silent --mode=compile gcc  -g -O2 -pthreads -DNO_DBM_REWRITEMAP    -DSOLARIS2=7 -D_POSIX_PTHREAD_SEMANTICS -D_REENTRANT -DAP_HAVE_DESIGNATED_INITIALIZER   -I. -I/phil/src/httpd-2.0.35/os/unix -I/phil/src/httpd-2.0.35/server/mpm/prefork -I/phil/src/httpd-2.0.35/modules/http -I/phil/src/httpd-2.0.35/modules/proxy -I/phil/src/httpd-2.0.35/include -I/phil/src/httpd-2.0.35/srclib/apr/include -I/phil/src/httpd-2.0.35/srclib/apr-util/include -I/phil/src/httpd-2.0.35/modules/dav/main -I/phil/src/httpd-2.0.35/srclib/apr-util/include -I/phil/src/httpd-2.0.35/srclib/apr-util/xml/expat/lib  -c mod_access.c && touch mod_access.slo
/bin/sh /phil/src/httpd-2.0.35/shlibtool --silent --mode=link gcc  -g -O2 -pthreads -DNO_DBM_REWRITEMAP    -DSOLARIS2=7 -D_POSIX_PTHREAD_SEMANTICS -D_REENTRANT -DAP_HAVE_DESIGNATED_INITIALIZER   -I. -I/phil/src/httpd-2.0.35/os/unix -I/phil/src/httpd-2.0.35/server/mpm/prefork -I/phil/src/httpd-2.0.35/modules/http -I/phil/src/httpd-2.0.35/modules/proxy -I/phil/src/httpd-2.0.35/include -I/phil/src/httpd-2.0.35/srclib/apr/include -I/phil/src/httpd-2.0.35/srclib/apr-util/include -I/phil/src/httpd-2.0.35/modules/dav/main -I/phil/src/httpd-2.0.35/srclib/apr-util/include -I/phil/src/httpd-2.0.35/srclib/apr-util/xml/expat/lib -export-dynamic       -o mod_access.la -rpath NONE/libexec -module -avoid-version  mod_access.lo 
shlibtool: link: only absolute run-paths are allowed
make[4]: *** [mod_access.la] Error 1
creator: js@phil.uu.nl

text:
-rpath NONE/libexec 
 
That's the problem I'm having too on linux. "$prefix" is being used instead of 
${prefix}, my build/config_vars.mk is being created incorrectly: 
(...) 
mandir = $exec_prefix/share/man 
libdir = ${exec_prefix}/lib 
(...) 
 
There is a difference :)
creator: andreas@netbank.com.br

text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 7790 ***
creator: slive@apache.org
jerenkrantz@apache.org
text:
A few notes:

- This almost certainly isn't related to 7790, so reopening.
- Changing the summary to reflect (IMHO) the problem
- This is almost certainly related to a bad config file layout - specifically
your Phil layout in the phil.layout file.  It probably doesn't escape ${} the
variables, but just has $.

So, this is a bug not related to our config.layouts - which all seem to have the
${}-escaping correct.

Please check your phil.layout file to see if this is the case.  If it isn't
please reopne this bug.

Thanks for using Apache!

Resolving as INVALID until it is known for sure whether this is a real bug in
one of the layouts distributed with httpd-2.0.
creator: jerenkrantz@apache.org
